critique: The document discusses amending a rule regarding filling vacancies in the absence of eligible candidates. The tone is formal and bureaucratic, focusing on procedure and limitations. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of stability and order, ensuring that government functions can continue even when there are staffing shortages, while also maintaining the integrity of the merit-based system. There's a secondary desire to alleviate potential fear or anxiety about disruptions in government services due to vacancies. There is not enough information to suggest the presence of other emotions.
